title: How will the Hummer EV compare to the Tesla CyberTruck? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s difficult to say because both should be considered, to some degree, as vaporware until the specs that each automaker promise can be seen and verified in the real world. Tesla has released more projected specifications about the Cybertruck than GM has for the Hummer EV, and there is an actual Cybertruck that’s been seen driving around L.A. (usually with Musk at the helm), so the Cybertruck at least gets the nod for exiting in the real world. The Hummer EV, for now, is just a few promised specs and one teaser image from GM. Motor1 has, however, produced a speculative render of what it may actually look like: 2022 GMC Hummer EV: Everything We Know. It’s official debut where we’ll see the whole thing and probably get more projected specifications happens on May 20, 2020. This is what we know of each vehicle so far. Tesla Cybertruck 250–500 miles or range$39,900 - $69,9000–60 mph in 2.9 seconds6.5-foot pickup bedtow up to 14,000 pounds3,500-pound cargo capacityavailable with either a single-motor / rear-wheel-drive setup, a dual-motor / all-wheel-drive setup, or a tri-motor / all-wheel-drive arrangement.35-degree approach angle, 28-degree departure anglebullet-proof (resistant?) glassstainless-steel exoskeletonelectric outlets and air lines for power tools are built into the truckGMC Hummer EV 1,000 horsepower11,500 lb-ft of torque (misleading because this metric is measured a different way than the SAE industry standard)0–60 mph in 3 seconds

One of these vehicles will have this fast charging network in the USA:  and the other will have this one:  Ref: plugshare.com Go there if you want a better look. One of these vehicles will have that charging map built right into it, with a route planner that gets automatically updated on a daily basis:  The other… might. But GM’s track record for stuff like this isn’t so great. One will have self-driving software and hardware, with all-around cameras and Sentry Mode as standard equipment.  Nobody knows what the Hummer will have yet. But who cares about any of that? The Hummer will look better:  Note: not an actual prototype. And honestly, that’s what everyone looks for in a giant, off-road vehicle, amirite?
